decks.notes: The key strategy of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using Entomb, Faithless Looting, and Collective Brutality, in order to reanimate them with Animate Dead, Reanimate, or Exhume. The deck aims to bring out game-winning creatures such as Griselbrand, Iona, or Tidespout Tyrant as early as possible by using fast mana acceleration from Lotus Petal and Chrome Mox. Thoughtseize helps disrupt the opponent's strategy while Dark Ritual provides extra mana to cast multiple spells in a single turn. The deck relies on a strong combo strategy to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through cards like Lotus Petal, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Rite of Flame, while using spells like Dark Ritual and Chrome Mox to further accelerate the combo. The deck aims to draw through the deck with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key combo pieces like Ad Nauseam or Burning Wish. Once assembled, the deck can use Infernal Tutor to search for win conditions like Empty the Warrens and overwhelm the opponent with a storm of spells for a quick victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Abrupt Decay while also maintaining card advantage through Ponder and Brainstorm. It aims to apply early pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, supported by disruption from cards like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also includes some versatile threats like True-Name Nemesis and Baleful Strix to provide additional value. Additionally, it utilizes the powerful mana denial strategy of Wasteland in conjunction with the graveyard disruption capabilities of Deathrite Shaman.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Faithless Looting, Entomb, and Collective Brutality, then using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring those creatures back onto the battlefield. The key strategy is to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria as early as possible, overwhelming the opponent with threats that are difficult to deal with. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Chancellor of the Annex to protect its combo pieces.

This Grixis Aggro deck aims to apply early pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland and Daze. The deck also includes powerful disruption spells like Counter spells, such as Force of Will and Spell Pierce, and removal options like Lightning Bolt and Dismember. The deck is able to maintain card advantage and find key pieces with cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, while utilizing cards like Gitaxian Probe for additional information and synergy.

This Deadguy Ale deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Tidehollow Sculler, while also utilizing powerful removal like Swords to Plowshares and Liliana of the Veil. The deck aims to control the game early on with aggressive creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Dark Confidant, backed up by efficient removal and disruptive spells. The inclusion of equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and a variety of removal options allows for flexibility and adaptability in different matchups, making it a versatile and potent aggro deck in the Legacy format.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to aggressively control the board with efficient removal and disruptive spells like Fatal Push, Daze, and Cabal Therapy, while also applying pressure with evasive threats such as Delver of Secrets, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler. The deck also utilizes disruptive creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Baleful Strix to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck focuses on leveraging card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent. Ultimately, the goal is to control the game while continuously applying pressure to win the match.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of control elements and efficient creatures to disrupt opponents' strategies and gain incremental advantages. By utilizing disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze, along with powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic, the deck aims to control the game and eventually win with its resilient threats. The mana base is designed to provide flexibility and consistency, while the inclusion of cards like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Deathrite Shaman add additional disruption and value to the strategy. The deck excels in longer, grindy games where it can outvalue and outmaneuver opponents.

This deck utilizes the "Show and Tell" combo strategy to cheat powerful creatures into play quickly. By using "Show and Tell" or "Sneak Attack", the player can put formidable threats like Griselbrand or Emrakul onto the battlefield without paying their high mana costs. The deck includes cards like Omniscience and Lotus Petal to enable big plays early in the game. With a strong mix of card draw, counter spells, and tutor effects, this deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent with its explosive combo potential.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze, along with efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares. It utilizes powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to gain an advantage in combat. The deck also includes powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic to apply pressure on the opponent. Additionally, it has mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Deathrite Shaman, and card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to outvalue the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Food Chain combo to generate infinite mana and then use it to cast creatures such as Walking Ballista and Misthollow Griffin multiple times in the same turn. The deck includes cards like Force of Will and Brainstorm for control, along with cards like Deathrite Shaman to ramp up mana. The deck focuses on efficiently using its resources to establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

This deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plans by deploying aggressive creatures backed up by disruptive spells like Swords to Plowshares. It utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate to slow down opponents while using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play. The deck also has equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to provide additional pressure. With a mix of mana denial cards like Wasteland and disruptive creatures like Phyrexian Revoker, Death & Taxes aims to control the board and overwhelm opponents with efficient threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo, which involves creating a 20/20 flying indestructible creature token by removing all ice counters from Dark Depths. This combo is achieved by using cards such as Thespian's Stage, Crop Rotation, and Sylvan Scrying to find and copy Dark Depths, as well as cards like Vampire Hexmage to remove the counters. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to protect the combo and control the opponent's hand.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, allowing you to trigger abilities of cards like Ichorid and Narcomoeba. By sacrificing cards through cards like Cabal Therapy and Careful Study, you can trigger powerful effects like Bridge from Below and Dread Return. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures like Prized Amalgam and Flame-Kin Zealot, ultimately leading to a victory through a powerful combo play.

The deck is focused on disrupting the opponent's game plan while quickly applying pressure with efficient creatures. It utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down the opponent, while using Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to quickly bring out powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice or Batterskull. By constantly disrupting the opponent's resources and applying pressure with its creatures, the deck aims to control the game and come out on top in 1 vs 1 matchups.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through card advantage, counter spells, and removal while using Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels as win conditions. It relies heavily on cantrips like Ponder, Portent, and Brainstorm to manipulate the deck and find answers quickly. The inclusion of Predict allows for more consistency in drawing desired cards. Unexpectedly Absent provides additional removal options while Back to Basics punishes opponents playing nonbasic lands. The mana base is built around fetching dual lands to ensure access to all colors needed for spells.
